snippet: Despite fiscal austerity in Washington, the private sector is helping create jobs and force the overall unemployment rate in April down to its lowest level since the end of 2008.
abstract: Labor Department releases data showing private sector is still rolling ahead, helping create nearly 200,000 jobs a month, on average, since beginning of the year; as result overall 7.5 percent unemployment rate in April is lowest level since the end of 2008.
lead_paragraph: Despite fiscal austerity in Washington, the private sector is helping create jobs and force the overall unemployment rate in April down to its lowest level since the end of 2008.

headline.main: Jobs Data Eases Fears of Economic Slowdown in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Jobs Data Eases Fears Of a Sharp Slowdown; Joblessness Dips to 7.5%
